relation: 4 (discontinued, available while supplies last) or 8 GiByte (Not expandable, no memory card slot)
ARM1176JZF-S™ (with coprocessor) (Source: Bits und so Podcast #20, 8'40" to 9'30" [german language])
Quad-band GSM, WiFi (b/g), EDGE, Bluetooth 2.0 EDR (Bluetooth only supported for headsets, no RFCOMM or OBEX)
Locked to Apple-selected carrier (AT&T in the US), Older versions of the firmware can be unlocked (via third-party software)
2 megapixel camera, 4 buttons (power, volume up, volume down, mute, Home), accelerometer, ambient light sensor, proximity sensor
OS X (its own version of OS X)

Basic PDA + PMP software included. Native software can only be created by unauthorized hacking (Source); Apple's official answer is that their web browser has very good AJAX support and that apps should use that.
Playback (recording with third party hacks), speaker; 3.5mm jack (4 conductors: left/right/input/ground)
USB 2.0 on proprietary iPod dock connector
voids warranty and is extremely challenging. Refurbished iPhones always come with entirely new back covers (with special serial number prefixes that indicate they were refurbished)
Up to 8 hours talk, up to 7 video, up to 6 online, up to 24 hours audio playback, up to 250 hours standby. Non-user-replaceable Lithium-ion battery, charged via dock connector (USB)

USD 299 for 4GiB version (while supplies last), 399 for 8GiB (2 year contract required for activation of either; iPhone will not do anything without activation, although third party hacks bypass that for older firmware.)
Google for iPhone Community to list a few, ##iphone on freenode.net also
Neo1973(GTA02). For the earlier version see IPhone_(GTA01)
Quad-band GSM, GPRS Class12/CS4/b 2.5G (Not EDGE), WiFi, Bluetooth 2.0 EDR
Basic PDA included. Software can be created by normal users.

Playback and recording, including playback of audio files via GSM and recording/playback of voice calls. 1 watt mono speaker. [ http://lists.openmoko.org/pipermail/community/2007-July/008458.html] , 2.5 mm jack

Standard USB 1.1 (unpowered), with a Mini-B receptor (can be connected via adapter to both host and client devices), exposed I2C, SPI and debug board connector inside case in all versions and Debug Board v2 (JTAG and serial console) in Advanced version
Advanced version comes with guitar pick and Torx T6 screwdriver so you can open case.
replaceable 1.7 Ah battery charged via USB
USD 450 for Neo Base, USD 600 for Neo Advanced (includes additional development hardware)
IRC: #openmoko on freenode.net Discussion list, Wiki, Be informed when it is sold
Set up an OpenMoko event in your area!

textBeforeTable: iPhone UI Demo on youtube http://youtube.com/watch?v=YgW7or1TuFk Apple announced their iPhone at MacWorld 2007. It is fairly similar to the FIC Neo1973 announced in the fall of 2006. NOTE: The Neo1973 revision this page is about is the GTA02-revision that is announced for December 2007.
